title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

14:39 <vmassol> cjdelisle: seems it didn't work http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/23/testReport/  
14:42 <@cjdelisle> thanks for pointing that out, I got involved in orther things and forgot to look  
14:48 <vmassol> works on my machine (i have both ipv4 and ipv6)  
14:56 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you could display the bind address to the console from the test, or are you already doing that?  
14:56 <@cjdelisle> I did that yesterday, it binds to the ipv6 addr.  
14:56 <@cjdelisle> or used to  
14:57 <@cjdelisle> I assume it still does since the symptoms are the same.  
14:57 <vmassol> I don't see it printed on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/23/testReport/  
14:57 <vmassol> maybe you removed it  
14:57 <vmassol> so it would mean the passed param is not used  
14:57 <vmassol> s/passed/system/  
14:58 <vmassol> maybe that param needs to be passed when starting the jvm  
14:59 <@cjdelisle> I'm kind of feeling that.  
14:59 <vmassol> doing that too  
15:02 <vmassol> didn't find much…. found this but not conclusive: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5195154/setting-runtime-property-in-web-application  
15:02 <vmassol> I'd try to pass that property from the pom.xml if I were you though....  
15:02 <@cjdelisle> /nod  
15:18 <rrodriguez> has quit  
15:22 <vmassol> guys we still need to update http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SourceRepository  
15:22 <vmassol> (would be good that whoever moved contrib update it)

19:48 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you passed the property for ipv4 on the server side, was that voluntary?  
19:49 <vmassol> hmm actually it worked it seems: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/25/testReport/  
19:49 <vmassol> I'm not sure I understand why though :)
